abstract_ssm: This collection contains a poem written by Genevieve Earle to her nephew, Joseph K. Lane, on his 21st birthday, and one photograph of Earle standing on the steps of a home in Tupper Lake, N.Y.  Genevieve B. Earle (1883-1956) was head of the Brooklyn branch of the League of Women Voters, and was the first woman elected to the New York City Council, where she served as minority leader.
subject_ssm: Women city council members |z New York (State) |z New York
